See also: Töchter

German[edit]

Etymology[edit]

From Middle High German tohter, from Old High German tohter, from Proto-Germanic *duhtēr, from Proto-Indo-European *dʰugh₂tḗr. Compare Dutch dochter, English daughter, Swedish dotter.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /ˈtɔx.tɐ/, [ˈtɔx.tɐ], [ˈtɔχ.tɐ]
  • Audio
    		(file)
  • audio (Austria)
    		(file)

Noun[edit]

Tochter f (genitive Tochter, plural Töchter, diminutive Töchterchen n or Töchterlein n)

  1. daughter
  2. subsidiary (company)
